dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Okay. We're throwing a lot at ya here, so lemme step in an' help ya catch up. This is the story about comic books, an' a guy who made a whole life outta them. You could even say comics saved his life. This guy here, he's our man, Harvey Pekar -- all grown up and goin' nowhere. Although he's a pretty scholarly cat, he never got much of a formal education. For the most part, he's lived in shit neighborhoods, held shit jobs, and is now knee deep into a second disastrous marriage. So if yer lookin' for romance or escapism or some fantasy figure to save the day, guess what? Ya got the wrong movie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: SUDDENLY EVERYTHING -- THE MUSIC, THE CREDITS, THE IMAGES -- COMES TO A HALT
DAY HIGH DEFINITION VIDEO DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE

direction.raw_text: PRESENT - DAY HIGH DEFINITION VIDEO DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE The REAL HARVEY PEKAR (not the actor who trudged through the credits) sits behind a microphone, supplying the "voice over" above. He clutches a movie script in his hand. The frame is spare, with a few well-chosen items to indicate that he's in a recording session. Although he is significantly older than the man who portrays him, the "Real Harvey" is every bit as much of a sad sack... maybe even more. He is large and slightly threatening with knitted brows and wild eyes. Yet there is something kind and vulnerable about him -- a teddy bear who could kick your ass. Off Camera, WE HEAR the voices of the male and female directors (us -- BOB and SHARI) coaching the "Real Harvey" through his voice over. Harvey's irritable and contrary, saying that the whole Halloween incident never even happened. "But I don't care man. I'm just doing this for the dough." We learn that Harvey is a reluctant participant in a film being made about his life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: his third wife JOYCE BRABNER -- an intelligent control freak obsessed with all things negative -- joins in the conversation. Pushing back her huge glasses, she reprimands Harvey like he is an infant: "Harvey you are talking too loud, Harvey you are being difficult." Harvey just rolls his eyes. Joyce gets offended. It is clear they have had this argument a million times. As Joyce storms off... Harvey explains that his wife is trying to take over the movie. He laments that she is his third wife, and he has no luck with women. "Man, chicks just don't dig me." That's why he marries anyone who will have him. "And I marry them fast before they get to know the real me..."
direction.name: direction

result.heading: END HIGH DEFINITION VIDEO DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE CUT TO

result.heading: GREEN SCREEN A SURREAL DREAM SEQUENCE

dialogue.raw_text: My name is Harvey Pekar. It's an unusual name -- Harvey Pekar...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: was the year I got my first apartment and my first telephone book. Imagine my surprise when I looked up my name and saw that, in addition to me, another Harvey Pekar was listed!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was listed as Harvey L. Pekar... My middle name is Lawrence... He was listed as Harvey Pekar -- no middle initial... Therefore, his was a purer listing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then, in the seventies, I noticed that a third Harvey Pekar was listed in the phone book! This filled me with curiosity.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How could there be three people with such an unusual name in the world, let alone in one city?!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then one day, a person I worked with expressed her sympathy to me concerning what she thought was the death of my father. She pointed out an obituary notice in the newspaper for a man named Harvey Pekar. One of his sons was named Harvey. These were the other Harvey Pekars.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Six months later, Harvey Pekar Jr. died. Although I'd met neither man, I was filled with sadness. "What were they like," I thought. It seemed that our lives had been linked in some indefinable way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But the story does not end there. For two years later another Harvey Pekar appeared in the directory. What kind of people are these? Where do they come from, what do they do? What's in a name?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ya keep readin' 'em backward.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I like reading them backward. (holding up a comic) Is that you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I keep tellin' ya, all of 'ems me, man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You look like a monster.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, well wait'll ya see what you're gonna look like.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Me??
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sure. Yer part of the story too, now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What story?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The story of my life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, I know I'm not as interesting as The Little Mermaid and all that magical crap...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe I want to write my own comic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh yeah? What about?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know yet. But not about you. You have enough already.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: FALL - PRESENT - DAY HARVEY walks towards the bus stop to send DANIELLE to school. He holds her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danielle looks up at Harvey like he's crazy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Danielle drops his hand and rushes onto the bus with other kids. Harvey waves and watches as it pulls away. He turns and walks by himself down the busy Cleveland street -- -- a familiar image from the opening. He's still hunched over. He's still Harvey.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Ya know, you should write about things in your own life. Like school and... ponies... I don't know, girl stuff...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Harvey) Do you have to hold my hand?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wounded) What, are you embarrassed a' me? I know, I'm embarrassing. I felt the same way about my father.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No Harvey. You're just squeezing it too hard. (shaking her head) Joyce is right. You are obsessive compulsive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Yeah, so I guess comics brought me a lot. But don't think this is some sunny, happy ending. Every day is still a major struggle. Joyce an' I fight like crazy, an' she barely works. The kid's got A.D.D. and is a real handful. My expenses have gone up so much that I'm writin' freelance 'round the clock, just to make my bills. My life is total chaos.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: DAY DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE -- SHOT ON FILM NOW THE REAL HARVEY

direction.raw_text: FALL - PRESENT - DAY DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE -- SHOT ON FILM NOW THE REAL HARVEY walks down the same busy Cleveland street towards his job.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) With a little luck, I'll get a window of good health between retirin' an dyin'. The golden years, right? Who knows. Between my pension and the chunk of change I got for this movie, I should be able to swing somethin'. Sure I'll lose the war eventually, but the goal is to win a few skirmishes along the way. Right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: DAY DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE -- SHOT ON FILM THE REAL HARVEY

direction.raw_text: .A. HOSPITAL - PRESENT - DAY DOCUMENTARY FOOTAGE -- SHOT ON FILM THE REAL HARVEY slumps at the desk now, flipping through a comic book.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: comes into the file room, carrying a cake with sparklers. He's followed by a group of Harvey's REAL COWORKERS and JOYCE and REAL DANIELLE. Harvey moves the comic off his desk so Toby can put the cake down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The festive cake reads "HAPPY RETIREMENT HARVEY." REAL JOYCE cuts the cake and passes slices to the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: pops a bottle of champagne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: on a glass of champagne getting filled. The glass sits next to the comic Harvey was reading.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP ON COMIC BOOK COVER HARVEY'S new edition of AMERICAN SPLENDOR is subtitled, "OUR MOVIE YEAR." It features an illustration of HARVEY, JOYCE and DANIELLE surrounded by cameras, lights and crew.
direction.name: direction
